title: Maunally saved "champions" folder (itemsets) doesn't work
body:
Hello guys, I'm having problems with showing my item sets after pasting my manually saved champions folder into the newly created LoL folder (i.e reinstalled the game). 

Before uninstalling, I've copied the whole "config" folder and pasted the whole thing back the to the LoL folder when I reinstalled freshly.
The input and game settings has been preserved though I'm not able to see any of my previously saved item sets in the client. 

Is there a way to show my item sets?

replies.body:
Your item sets are probably gone. They are saved outside of your "Config" folder. Specifically, they are in "C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_air_client\releases\0.0.1.XXX\deploy\preferences" (where XXX is replaced with the highest number there). This also presumes you used the default install location. **Also,** this contains the item sets of any account played on that computer. It's pretty obvious which file belongs to whom.

Until they change the way item sets are coded, you can just copy these files from your old client's files into your new ones. Remember to always do it to the latest folder (a new install should only have one there, so it's a no-brainer).

~the more you know~

I've had this happen to me before and by god, I was not happy about it. It's still really strange how Riot still do that. Maybe they're just holding out for the new item set manager.

Bugger me... I had like 40 or so saved item sets. It's going to be pain in the ass to create those again. 

Anyway thanks for the heads up I really appreciate it.

Also, if you ever want to upgrade your OS in general, it's *really* handy to make a list of all the apps you use so you can install them all in one day~

(If you were really desperate to get the old sets back then you might have some luck in trying out a data recovery program, although most are costly and it will still take some time to sort through it all.)
